column4: if i can install BT4 in dual boot mode using 10 Gb, why should i use a VM that will consume the same 10 Gb? whats the difference?
what is bt4?
use your favorite text editor?
i mean only in CLI, nothing with GUI, im stuck in console
yes, there are text editors that do not use a gui.  Like nano or vim.  But I would suggest instead just stating your real issue (why do you want to create an xorg.conf?) to the channel
i have the trident problem. the screen is messed. so i have read in forums that i need to create the xorg.conf file. leafpad command display "cant open the visor"
Xorg -configure will generate some sort of minimal xorg.conf
i have this problem, when i do "sudo Xorg -configure" i get "fatal server error: could not create lock file in /temp/.tX0-lock
did your error actually say "temp" or was that a typo on your part?
it was a typo. it says /tmp/
can you pastebin the error in its entirety?
i think i cant, i am testing all in an old pc without network
ok
can you write to /tmp?
can i try with nano?
sure, try: nano /tmp/mamece2test
error ! i try to save in nano and it says its read only
but i did chmod 1777 /tmp/
can you pastebin the line in the output of « mount » corresponding to the partition /tmp is on?
llutz_  i did mount but.. there a lot of info,. i dont see any /tmp/ there
so , im root and i cant write in the X11 folder... help
